course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Orientation Lectures in Molecular Biology and Genetics

notes.note: Intended for freshman, sophomores, and transfer students.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Principles of Cell and Developmental Biology

notes.note: Biological science majors must take this course for a letter grade.
Not open to students majoring in biological sciences; may not be used to fulfill requirements for biological sciences major. Highly recommended prerequisite: problem-solving sessions.

Recommended prerequisite: BIOG 1500. Lab assignments made during 1st lecture. Highly recommended prerequisite: problem-solving sessions. Biological sciences majors must take the course for a letter grade.

Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course and one year general chemistry; and CHEM 1570, or 3570-3580, or equivalents; or permission of instructor. CHEM 3580 may be co-registered. May not be taken for credit after BIOMG 3310, 3320, 3330, or 3350. Co-registration in BIOMG 3340 is encouraged. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade. Organizational meeting: Monday, Jan. 24th, 4:30 P.M., BKL 200. Attendance is required.

Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course and previous or co-registration in organic chemistry, or permission of instructor. May not be taken for credit after BIOMG 3300 or BIOMG 3330 or BIOMG 3350.
Co-register: BIOMG 3300 or permission of instructor. Organizational meeting: Monday, Jan. 24th, 4:30PM, BKL 200.
Co-register: BIOMG 3300 or permission of instructor. Organizational meeting: Monday, Jan. 24th, 4:30PM, BKL 200.
Co-register: BIOMG 3300 or permission of instructor. Organizational meeting: Monday, Jan. 24th, 4:30PM, BKL 200.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Principles of Biochemistry: Proteins, Metabolism and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course; and one year general chemistry, and CHEM 1570, or CHEM 3570-3580; or equivalents, or permission of instructor. CHEM 3580 may be co-registration. May not be taken for credit after BIOMG 3300, BIOMG 3310, BIOMG 3320, or BIOMG 3330. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Mathematical Modeling and Computational Statistics of the Molecular Cell

notes.note: Permission required for undergraduate students.

Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300 or BIOMG 3330 or BIOMG 3350 or BIOMG 3310; previous or co-registration in BIOMG 3320, or equivalent. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 2810. Undergraduate students must enroll in this course for letter grade; graduate students may enroll either for letter grade or S-U option.
Enrollment is limited to: upper-classman. Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350 or 3310/3320, or written permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350, or 3310/3320 or permission of instructor.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Laboratory in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Labs begin the first full week of the semester. Grad students must enroll by permission only.

course.course_title: Laboratory in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Labs begin the first full week of the semester. Grad students must enroll by permission only.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Stem Cell Biology: Basic Science and Clinical Applications

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 4320 or BIOMG 3850 or permission of instructor. S-U grades by permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: BIOEE 1780, BIOMG 2810, BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3320, or 3350. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 3850.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2810.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2810, BIOMG 3300 or 3330 or 3350 or 3310 and 3320.

Prerequisite: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Note: Arts students may not count this course toward graduation but may, upon petition (one time only) to their class dean, carry fewer than 12 other credits and remain in good standing. This would affect Dean's List eligibility but not eligibility for graduating with distinction.

course.course_title: Mathematical Modeling and Computational Statistics of the Molecular Cell

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350, or 3310/3320, and 4320, or equivalents.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2810 or equivalent.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300 or 3330 or 3350 or 3310/3320, or equivalent. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 2810.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Research Seminar in Genetics and Development

notes.note: Enrollment limited to and required for: second-year and beyond graduate students in genetics and development.
Enrollment limited to: graduate students in Genetics and Development.

Enrollment limited to: graduate students majoring in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell Biology.
Enrollment limited to and required for: first-year graduate students in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology.
Enrollment limited to and required for: second-, third-, and fourth-year graduate students majoring in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Quantitative Biology for Molecular Biology and Genetics

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: first-year Ph.D. students in the graduate fields of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology, or genetics and development. For all other students, permission of instructor is required.
Enrollment limited to: second-year graduate students majoring in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology. All other students, permission of instructor is required.
